TYO.Name: Tokyo Tower
TYO.Description: An iconic landmark and observation tower in Tokyo.

TYO.Name: Meiji Shrine
TYO.Description: One of Japan's most famous shrines, surrounded by a lush forest.

TYO.Name: Senso-ji Temple
TYO.Description: An ancient Buddhist temple, known for its Thunder Gate and vibrant shopping street.

TYO.Name: Shibuya Crossing
TYO.Description: One of the world's busiest pedestrian crossings and a symbol of Tokyo's energy.

TYO.Name: Ueno Park
TYO.Description: A spacious public park with museums, a zoo, and cherry blossoms in spring.

OSA.Name: Osaka Castle
OSA.Description: A famous castle with beautiful gardens and a museum.

OSA.Name: Dotonbori
OSA.Description: A bustling shopping and restaurant district in Osaka.

OSA.Name: Universal Studios Japan
OSA.Description: A major theme park with attractions based on popular movies.

OSA.Name: Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan
OSA.Description: One of the largest public aquariums in the world.

OSA.Name: Shitennoji Temple
OSA.Description: One of Japan's oldest Buddhist temples.

FUK.Name: Fukuoka Tower
FUK.Description: The tallest seaside tower in Japan, offering panoramic views of the city.

FUK.Name: Ohori Park
FUK.Description: A peaceful park centered around a large pond, perfect for strolling and relaxation.

FUK.Name: Kushida Shrine
FUK.Description: A historical Shinto shrine known for its annual Gion Yamakasa festival.

FUK.Name: Canal City Hakata
FUK.Description: A large shopping and entertainment complex with a canal running through it.

FUK.Name: Fukuoka Asian Art Museum
FUK.Description: A museum featuring modern and contemporary Asian art.

NGO.Name: Nagoya Castle
NGO.Description: A historic castle known for its golden shachihoko and extensive grounds.

NGO.Name: Atsuta Shrine
NGO.Description: One of the most important Shinto shrines in Japan, housing sacred relics.

CTS.Name: Sapporo Clock Tower
CTS.Description: A symbol of Sapporo, known for its American-style architecture.

CTS.Name: Odori Park
CTS.Description: A large public park hosting major events like the Sapporo Snow Festival.

KKJ.Name: Kokura Castle
KKJ.Description: A historic castle in Kitakyushu with beautiful gardens and a museum.

KKJ.Name: Mojiko Retro
KKJ.Description: A nostalgic district in Kitakyushu, famous for its preserved Meiji and Taisho era buildings.

TAK.Name: Ritsurin Garden
TAK.Description: A scenic garden in Takamatsu, known for its beautiful landscapes and historical tea houses.

TAK.Name: Kawaramachi Street
TAK.Description: A vibrant shopping street in Takamatsu offering a range of shops and local eateries.

KMJ.Name: Kumamoto Castle
KMJ.Description: One of Japan's most famous castles, known for its impressive stone walls and samurai history.

KMJ.Name: Suizenji Jojuen Garden
KMJ.Description: A traditional Japanese garden in Kumamoto, famous for its miniature recreations of iconic landscapes.

MYJ.Name: Dogo Onsen
MYJ.Description: Japan's oldest hot spring bathhouse, offering a unique experience in Matsuyama.

MYJ.Name: Matsuyama Castle
MYJ.Description: An important cultural property of Japan, offering panoramic views of the city from its hilltop location.

OKA.Name: Shurijo Castle
OKA.Description: A reconstructed Ryukyuan gusuku (castle), symbolizing the history and culture of Okinawa.

OKA.Name: Kokusai Street
OKA.Description: A bustling street in Naha, Okinawa, known for its shops, restaurants, and cultural experiences.

SDJ.Name: Sendai Station
SDJ.Description: A major railway station in Sendai, connecting various parts of the city and region.

SDJ.Name: Aoba Castle Ruins
SDJ.Description: Historical ruins in Sendai offering insights into the city's samurai past.

NGS.Name: Mount Inasa
NGS.Description: A hill in Nagasaki known for its spectacular night views of the city.

NGS.Name: Nagasaki Peace Park
NGS.Description: A park commemorating the atomic bombing of Nagasaki, promoting peace and reflection.

TOY.Name: Toyama Castle
TOY.Description: A castle in Toyama city, featuring a museum and picturesque castle grounds.

TOY.Name: Kansui Park
TOY.Description: A beautiful park surrounding a lake, known for its relaxing atmosphere and coffee shops.

HIJ.Name: Hiroshima Peace Memorial
HIJ.Description: A memorial park in Hiroshima dedicated to the victims of the atomic bomb in 1945.

HIJ.Name: Shukkeien Garden
HIJ.Description: A historic Japanese garden in Hiroshima, known for its beautiful landscapes and tea ceremony rooms.

HSG.Name: Saga Castle
HSG.Description: A historical castle in Saga, known for its unique wooden reconstruction.

HSG.Name: Yoshinogari Historical Park
HSG.Description: An archaeological park in Saga, featuring reconstructed Yayoi period buildings.

FSZ.Name: S-Pulse Dream Plaza
FSZ.Description: A large entertainment complex in Shizuoka with shops, restaurants, and a Ferris wheel.

FSZ.Name: Sunpu Castle
FSZ.Description: A historic castle in Shizuoka, offering a glimpse into the region's samurai past.
